intro: Pseudogynoxys sodiroi, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. The plant features showy yellow-orange composite flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are usually alternate, ovate, and covered with fine hairs. Pseudogynoxys sodiroi is often grown for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
